Package org.rakiura.cpn

An object-oriented hierarchical Coloured Petri Net implementation.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
Arc Represents an abstract Arc in the JFern Petri Net.
Context Represents public access protocol to CpnContexts.
Net Represents a Colour Petri Net.
NetElement Represents an abstract node element.
NetVisitor Utility for network analysis and graph traversal.
Simulator Represents a protocol to a simulator.
ThreadedSimulator.TimeListener Represents an object that can listen to changes in the simulation time of this Simulator.
 

Class Summary
AbstractArc Implements an abstract Arc.
BasicNet Implements a basic Petri Net.
BasicSimulator Basic implementation of the simulator.
CpnBshLanguage Represents a helper for BeanShell based inscriptions.
CpnClojureLanguage Represents a helper for Clojure-based inscriptions.
CpnContext Represents a CPN context.
CpnKawaLanguage Represents a helper for Kawa/Scheme based inscriptions.
CpnLanguage Represents abstraction over the CPN Inscription Language.
InputArc Represents an input Arc in JFern Petri Net model.
Marking Implments a basic Marking concept.
Multiset Represents a bag of tokens, a multiset.
NetGenerator Utility class to read XML net description and generates the JFern Java source file.
NetVisitorAdapter Utility class for graph traversal.
Node Basic abstract implementation of the NetElement.
OutputArc Represents an output Arc in Petri Net.
Place Represents a Place in the JFern Petri Net.
ThreadedSimulator A Petri net simulator and executor.
TimedSimulator Represents basic timed simulator.
Transition Represents a transition in JFern Petri net model.
Version  
XMLSerializer Class that arranges saving a JFERN net to XML.
XmlUtil Set of utilities for XML Document processing.
 

Package org.rakiura.cpn Description

An object-oriented hierarchical Coloured Petri Net implementation.

The net consists of places, transitions, arcs and subnets. Different places can be fused, so that tokens entering or exiting a place is also entering and exiting in the other places. Coloured tokens can be any java-class. Nets are saved as XML documents. The nets can be simulated and time can be included as well. The package org.rakiura.cpn.gui Provides a GUI to draw, show, edit, simulate etc. the Petri nets.
